title: Test
yAxis: Average ticket price in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 10 data points.
Overall Average ticket price in U.S. dollars has increased over the Year
Average ticket price in U.S. dollars is roughly constant from 2005/06 to 2006/07, gradually increasing from 2006/07 to 2007/08, and lastly gradually constant from 2007/08 to 2014/15.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2006/07 and 2007/08.
Max Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 78.8 was recorded at Year 2014/15
Min Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 34.88 was recorded at Year 2005/06, and 2006/07
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 10 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2010/11 to 2014/15.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2005/06 to 2007/08.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately constant which exists from 2009/10 to 2010/11.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2008/09 to 2009/10.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2007/08 to 2008/09.
